back:
(box model) width

  • distance from left inner edge to right iner edge height
  • inner top edge to inner bottom edge

note: this properties do not apply to inline non-replace elements

margin - separation between most normal-flow elements occurs because of margins. 

h1 {margin: 0.25in; background-color: silver;}

- sets a quarter inch of blank space around an h1 element

(margin: top right bottom left - TRBL 'trouble')

h1 {margin: 10px 20px 15px 5px;}

h1 {margin: 10px 20px;} /* equivalent h1 {margin: 10px 20px 10px 20px;} */
applying margins to an inline nonreplaced element will have no effect on the line-height, only the left and right margins are effected

border - simply one or more lines that surround the content and padding of an element.

Three attributes: width, style, color.

a:link {border-style: outset;}

p.aside {border-style: solid dashed dotted solid;}

h1 {border-style:solid; border-left-style: none;}

p { border-width: thick; }

h1 {border-style: dotted; border-width: thin 0;}

p {border-style: solid; border-width: 15px 2px 7px 4px;}

p {border-style: solid; border-color: gray;}

h1 {border-style: solid; border-color: black rgb(25%,25%,25%,25%) #808080 silver;}

h1 {border-bottom: thick solid gray;}

h2 {border: thick silver solid; border-left-width: 20px;}
